schemes.title: Pradhan Mantri Fasal Bima Yojana (PMFBY)
schemes.description: Comprehensive crop insurance scheme providing financial support to farmers suffering crop loss/damage arising out of unforeseen events.
schemes.eligibility: All farmers including sharecroppers and tenant farmers growing notified crops
schemes.benefits: Up to Rs. 2 lakh per farmer per season. Premium rates: Kharif - 2%, Rabi - 1.5%, Horticultural crops - 5%
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through Common Service Centers, banks, or online portal within cut-off dates
schemes.deadline: Cut-off dates vary by season and state

schemes.title: Kerala State Horticultural Mission
schemes.description: Promoting horticultural development in Kerala through various subsidy schemes and technical support
schemes.eligibility: Small and marginal farmers, SHG members, and entrepreneurs in Kerala
schemes.benefits: 50-75% subsidy for horticultural activities, equipment, and infrastructure development
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply through District Collectors office or online portal

schemes.title: Kisan Credit Card (KCC)
schemes.description: Credit facility for farmers to meet their agricultural and ancillary activities
schemes.eligibility: All farmers including tenant farmers, oral lessees, and sharecroppers
schemes.benefits: Credit up to Rs. 3 lakh at 4% interest rate with 3% interest subvention
schemes.how_to_apply: Apply at any cooperative bank, RRB, or commercial bank
schemes.contact_info: Contact nearest bank branch or call 1800-180-1551

schemes.title: PM-KISAN Samman Nidhi Yojana
schemes.description: Direct income support of Rs. 6000 per year to eligible farmer families
schemes.eligibility: Small and marginal farmer families having cultivable land up to 2 hectares
schemes.benefits: Rs. 2000 per installment, three times a year directly to bank account
schemes.how_to_apply: Online registration at pmkisan.gov.in or through Common Service Centers

schemes.title: Kerala Coconut Development Board Scheme
schemes.description: Support for coconut cultivation, processing, and marketing in Kerala
schemes.eligibility: Coconut farmers and groups in Kerala
schemes.benefits: Subsidies for planting, farm mechanization, processing units setup

schemes.title: National Mission on Sustainable Agriculture (NMSA)
schemes.description: Enhancing agricultural productivity through climate resilient practices
schemes.eligibility: All categories of farmers with focus on small and marginal farmers
schemes.benefits: Support for climate resilient technologies, soil health management, water conservation
schemes.how_to_apply: Through State Agriculture Departments and implementing agencies

schemes.title: Kerala Spices Development Programme
schemes.description: Promoting spice cultivation and value addition in Kerala
schemes.eligibility: Spice farmers, farmer groups, and processing units in Kerala
schemes.benefits: 50-75% subsidy for spice cultivation, processing equipment, and organic certification
schemes.how_to_apply: Through Kerala Spice Board and District Agriculture Offices

schemes.title: Soil Health Card Scheme
schemes.description: Providing soil health cards to farmers with recommendations for nutrient management
schemes.benefits: Free soil testing and customized fertilizer recommendations
schemes.how_to_apply: Contact Village Level Worker or nearest Agriculture Office

schemes.title: Kerala Bamboo Mission
schemes.description: Promoting bamboo cultivation and bamboo-based enterprises in Kerala
schemes.eligibility: Farmers, SHGs, and entrepreneurs in Kerala
schemes.benefits: 90% subsidy for bamboo plantation, 50% for processing units
schemes.how_to_apply: Through Kerala Bamboo Corporation and Forest Department

schemes.title: National Horticulture Mission
schemes.description: Holistic development of horticulture sector covering fruits, vegetables, root & tuber crops, mushrooms, spices, flowers, aromatic plants, coconut and cashew
schemes.eligibility: Individual farmers, groups of farmers, SHGs, FPOs
schemes.benefits: Area expansion, productivity enhancement, post harvest management, marketing support
schemes.how_to_apply: Through State Horticulture Departments and implementing agencies
